Metadata.Title: The Domain And Path Values of Session Cookies Are Strict
Metadata.DirectLink: The Domain And Path Values of Session Cookies Are Strict

Content.Data:
Applies to

  • PHP

What to Check For

Verify that domain and path values of session cookies are strict.

Why

Setting strict domain and path values on session cookies makes it harder for attackers to hijack user sessions.

How to Check

To verify that domain and path values of session cookies are strict:

  1. Define a strict cookie path. Use the application path as the cookie path.

  2. Define a strict cookie domain. If the application uses a subdomain, use it as the cookie domain value.

  3. Examine the path and domain values. View the php.ini file to make sure that strict values for the session cookie domain and path properties are set using "session.cookie_domain" and "session.cookie_path" directives respectively.

How to Fix

To set strict domain and path values on session cookies:

  1. Define a strict cookie path. Use the application path as the cookie path.

  2. Define a strict cookie domain. If the application uses a subdomain, use it as the cookie domain value.

  3. Set the path and domain values. Edit the php.ini file. Set "session.cookie_path" to the strict cookie path. Set "session.cookie_domain" to the strict cookie domain.

Additional Resources

  • For more information about PHP runtime configuration, see http://php.net/manual/en/session.configuration.php
